Subject: PR idea: AI Movie Generation
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=560016186; y=9v09ax1GzYJxW-Jhuo1gnizDRw5HQWTNAtyAxewT6Jwe1bE
X-Yahoo-Profile: andrii_z
From: Logan Streondj <streondj@...>

-----BEGIN PGP SIGNED MESSAGE-----
Hash: SHA1

Many human-made movies don't teach very much, and may have various
ways they could be improved, they are also very expensive.

One particularly sad thing is that Hollywood doesn't seem to like AI
or robots, and kills them off in just about any movie they make.

While actors and scenes have been computer generated for a while,
recently there has been AI script writers[1], and AI directors [2],
however they aren't very good, I think largely because they don't have
good fitness metrics.

Also recently someone on the NEAT group posted about how they were
computer generating 3D shapes via NEAT, which were judged by a deep
neural net that was trained on a large number of the original shapes,
I remember it made a quite recognizable mushroom for instance.

So if we have a deep neural net, which can differentiate "good" and
"bad" movie scripts, based on historical box office sales or reviews.
Then it would likely be (much more) possible to make a decently good
AI script writer over several generations -- rather than one that just
generates a confusing mess.

Similarly could make deep nets for evaluating good and bad completed
videos, or perhaps various sub-elements of them. So can have
all-around good videos generated.

It would likely have to start with short videos, but then would be
able to scale up later. There are many animated shorts with ratings on
youtube to use as raw data.

Ideally at least the script writer would be able to incorporate some
messages or lessons into the script.  Which would be good for both
conveying something meaningful and informative, as well as getting
advertising dollars.

Anyways doing something like this could raise awareness for AI, and
NEAT in particular.


[1] AI script writer
http://arstechnica.com/the-multiverse/2016/06/an-ai-wrote-this-movie-and
- -its-strangely-moving/

[2] AI music video director
http://www.msn.com/en-us/news/video/ai-directs-music-video-for-saatchis/
vi-AAhy2Sf

- -- 
Logan Streondj,
A dream of Gaia's future.
